definition: to step down from office/to go into opposition
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: They seem to make better proposals when they are out of office than when they are in power.
sentences.chinese: 他們似乎下野時比執政時能提出更好的建議。

sentences.english: The Democrats are out, the Republicans in.
sentences.chinese: 民主黨下野，共和黨執政。

sentences.english: It was reported that Chiang, though going into retirement, would maintain control over the peace movements.
sentences.chinese: 據報道，蔣雖然行將下野，但仍將繼續控制和談。

sentences.english: Pro-government legislators argue that the opposition is seeking to ease Mr Chávez out of office.
sentences.chinese: 保皇派議員則認爲反對派是企圖讓查韋斯下野。

definition: Duan Qirui (1864-1936), commander of Beiyang Army under Yuan Shikai, then politician and powerful warlord
Li Zongren (1891-1969), a leader of Guangxi warlord faction
Chiang Kai-shek (1887-1975), military leader, head of the Nationalist government in China 1928-1949 and the government in exile on Taiwan 1950-1975
Wang Ching-wei (1883-1944), left-wing Guomingdang politician, subsequently Japanese collaborator
Bai Chongxi (1893-1966), a leader of Guangxi warlord faction, top Nationalist general, played important role in Chiang Kaishek's campaigns 1926-1949
Lu Rongting (1858-1928), provincial governor of Guangxi under the Qing, subsequently leader of old Guangxi warlord faction
Nationalist government 1920s-1949 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
the Warlord government of Northern China that developed from the Qing Beiyang army 北洋軍閥|北洋军阀 after the Xinhai revolution of 1911
honorific title for Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石[Jiang3 Jie4 shi2]
confrontation of 1929 between Chiang Kaishek and the Guangxi warlord faction
war of 1920 between Northern Warlords, in which the Zhili faction beat the Anhui faction and took over the Beijing government
